reviews.text: Well where to start.. First I usually do not review my business travel accommodations - but I am making an exception. The location of the King Edward is at the outer east end of the Theater District and Financial District. I think it is outside these areas. Airport shuttles do not stop here as it is out f the way and a smaller property. There is considerable construction right next to the hotel and from early morning I was disturbed to early evening. Room furnishings are acceptable, but the room I had (and the others I saw) are basically a refurbishment. My Superior King had a separate bathtub and sink (the tub was at least 20-30 years old and smallish. The toilet and vanity were in a separate room. For one person this means running back and forth but would have plus for a couple. Room size was very good, lots of space in the bedroom. King bed was good, pillows were all feather, down mix, even though my Starwood profile requests synthetic (due to allergies). Floor in room uneven, carpet bucked all over. Single pain glazing so you hear everything outside. The rooms themselves are nothing better than 3*. The lobby and food/bar areas are very nice and well maintained. There is a very small business centre. Amenities are few. The hotel rates itself as a 5* and I have stayed at a great many and this place is lacking the services, amenities and outstanding staff one would find in a 5 star property. An example is how front desk handled my complaints about a wild party down the hall that continued until 3 am...with cases of booze being brought in and people arriving that were not guests of the hotel. The noise was unbearable. 2 calls later nothing was stopping the party scene. At 5 am I was now a zombie...so showered and went out for a walk and breakfast. You would think they would have dealt with it or moved me and some other guests but nope. Sound like a 5 Star hotel to you??. On my last day I had the breakfast special which was very enjoyable, eggs, bacon, coffee, juice and toast - tax and tip for $25 per person. I also attended a hosted event and the ood was very good. The waiters in the restaurant and bars were outstanding and made up for what is lacking in the quality of the rooms, however some of the front desk staff could barely speak English while the Concierge provided "constrained" service that was not friendly. Often they and the doorman were clustered on the street front chatting with the desk left unattended. I would not stay at the King Edward again unless it was the deal of the day. For the price I paid I could hve stayed at a truly solid 4 or 5 Star property.
reviews.title: Look Elewhere

reviews.text: I just came back from an actuarial conference there. I've been to older hotels and understand the difference between that and a newer Hilton for example. However, I was downgraded with no change in price and no attempt was made to appease me after several complaints about the size of the bed, poor internet connection, etc. Additionally, the hotel makes up their own exchange rate for all charges including hotel room so that if you pay in US dollars you pay 15% more than if you pay in Canadian dollars. Breakfast ended up being $51 for 2 eggs, pancakes, coffee, and juice.
reviews.title: Poor Everything

reviews.text: I went to Toronto on a work trip and booked the room at the King Eddie through Hotels.com.
reviews.title: Nice Old Hotel - In Good Location

likes.disliked: — The Lifts - Will they get there.........ever

reviews.text: The hotel was very grand at the entrance and there were people having high tea in the foyer. I arrived around 2pm and was told that my room was not ready. So I asked why (its European Standard to check in at 2pm) and they said check in was at 3pm - at the time I had been on a long flight and was not that impressed that I had to wait - was there no other rooms in the whole hotel for me???
reviews.title: Alright hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — Maintenance guy not believing me the air-con was broken and sorting it out sooner!

reviews.text: Anyway I waited the hour and went back - luckily to another receptionist. I asked about my room and again it was not ready as the people before had not checked out. I think I must have looked weary and surprisingly I was given a room that was ready - the miracle! I did my best not to grumble about the woman before that obviously could have given me a room but did not want to.
reviews.title: No value here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whast a great hotel, from the moment you walk through the door you know it will be good and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — the lovely feeling of being in a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding and decor have a lovely feeling of quiet luxury, with attentive staff and an excellent afternoon tea served in the lobby.
reviews.title: Expensive for what get
Never again ...
reviews.text: The room on the seventh floor was huge and the bed heavenly!
The hotel is wonderfully situated in down town and within walking distance of the downtown attractions including the distillery district.
reviews.title: OK for atmosphere, service great

likes.disliked: — High charge relative to value received

reviews.title: Great location, nice room, but $30 valet?!?!
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. First impressions were very impressive. A warm welcome and ornate reception area. However, our bedroom was not as specatcular. Very basic in my view - only one bathrobe; insufficient towels; no tea/coffee making facilities. Air conditioning was very noisy. We paid for the use of the executive club so had breakfast and afternoon drinks, which was a good experience. The hotel staff were overall friendly and helpful. I would say that this was an acceptable standard for a city hotel but this was very expensive and would have expected more care and attention to detail.

The King Eddy is great old hotel in the heart of Toronto. The club level rooms are elegant, large and luxurious. Service is very good from the front desk thru to the club lounge. I would stay at this very good business hotel again.
reviews.title: King Eddy rocks the old world

reviews.text: Excellent location, rooms and staff.
reviews.title: King Eddy

reviews.text: Great spot to tour what without doubt was and is one of the best ever family holidays. Staff were helpful and polite, the barman was fantastic. Hotel looks very grand in the pictures but not so grnad in reality. Rooms are average at best and not reflective of my previous le meridien experiences. All that being said such is it's close proximity to everything we would return
reviews.title: Truly Wonderful

likes.disliked: — Room Service Charges - ice @ $3.00 a bucket

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Book a trip to Toronto and stay at the King Edward without hesitation. The room was large, clean, and opulent. The service, from the front desk staff to the doorman to the hotel operator to the porter to the waitstaff, was outstanding. The location perfectly suited our needs. Wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel, great service

reviews.text: Wonderful stay, comfy big beds, smoking rooms available on the 9th floor with a nice view of the water. Minutes from the ACC! A coffeemaker in the room would have been nice, though. The elevators have been updated I am happy to say! The staff were very pleasant and accommodating, quick to valet and check in/out. I will be back.
reviews.title: Not a great stay

reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel, with large bedrooms! The lobby is as you see - very grand and the staff were helpful. The rooms are large: I had two queen beds, desk, separate chair and end table on the other side, 32 in flat screen LG LCDs, minibar, etc. VERY COMFORTABLE living. The location is awesome, as it's in the heart of downtown and within mins walking to Yonge street shopping and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Place but Use Priceline.com!

likes.liked: — Large rooms that fit two queen size beds!
likes.disliked: — hand delivered service for ice, valet parking, and pay-for-use internet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside is that everything has to be hand delivered to you. For example, there are no ice machines on the floors; thus, you have to call room service (no tip required but I DO feel bad not). It's strictly valet parking (tip again); thus, not convenient to come and go as you please. There's also charges for internet use!
reviews.title: Elegance and opulence in the middle of Toronto

reviews.text: I went on Priceline.com and got the room for $100 a night so I still saved overall and would stay here again... but not at the regular price of $300 night!!
reviews.title: Been here millions of times for funcitons and concerts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is beautiful, the concierge is friendly and helpful, and our room was huge and luxurious. And all right in the middle of Toronto, just minutes from gorgeous architecture and fabulous restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation Stay at the King Eddy

likes.liked: — location, wonderful staff, clean and comfortable room
likes.disliked: — the elevators...which weren't working well during our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We parked down King St in the municipal lot below the Dominion market, where parking is only CAN$5 between 5pm and 5am. We picked up our car around 9:30am and the total parking cost was CAN$15.
reviews.title: Bliss!
